Trees module¶

class Trees.Node(value)¶

A class implementing a tree.

Constructor. Takes the value of the node and initializes the right and the left child to None (i.e. it has no children).

Parameters

value (int) – Value of the node

append_left_child(child_value)¶

Method used to set a left child for the node. If the left child is empty (None) then we instantiate a new Node with the given value. If the left child is _not_ empty, then we create a new instance of a node. The left child of this new node becomes the left child of this current instance and then we set the left child of this instance equal to the new node. Basically, if it has a left child, we squish a new node in between.

Parameters

child_value (int) – Value to be given to a new Node instance that is going to become this node’s left child.

append_right_child(child_value)¶

Same as append_left_child but with the right child.

Parameters

child_value (int) – Value to be given to a new Node instance that is going to become this node’s right child.

Trees.print_tree()¶

Simple function to print a tree.
